Detailed Description

Describes a color used by all graphical operations. A color can be specified by it's value or as RGB or HSV values.

The result of the shown color depends on the available color-depth specified by the display-driver. For low-color displays, which internally use color-tables, a mapping to closest similar color is done. The mapped color is stored as ColorValue. It is recommended to work with the color-object itself instead of the display device dependant ColorValue.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Color::SystemColorId
 

Every theme offers specific color values to a system color ID. By using system color IDs instead of hard coded color values the output of applications automatically respects the look of a theme. E. g. use device_context->SetPenColor(Color::ClientForeground)); instead of a hard coded device_context->SetPenColor(Color(10, 200, 10));. The MMI may use custom color IDs starting with the range 100 (IDs from 0 to 99 are reserved for APOXI).

Enumerator:
ClientBackground  Background color for the client area of a window.
ClientForeground  Foreground color for the client area of a window.
ActiveFrameBackground  Background color for a window-frame when the window has the focus.
ActiveFrameForeground  Foreground color for a window-frame when the window has the focus.
InactiveFrameBackground  Background color for a window-frame when the window has not the focus.
InactiveFrameForeground  Foreground color for a window-frame when the window has not the focus.
SelectionBackground  Background color for selections e. g. used in listboxes.
SelectionForeground  Foreground color for selections e. g. used in listboxes.
Shaded  Color for inactive texts e. g. disabled actions.
ButtonBackground  Background color for any kind of button (e. g. push-button).
ButtonForeground  Foreground color for any kind of button (e. g. push-button).
ContextMenuBackground  Background color for a context menu.
ActiveWindowTitle  Color of the window title when the window has the focus.
InactiveWindowTitle  Color of the window title when the window has not the focus.
SystemColorIdCount 

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Color::Color (   ) 
 

Initializes the color-object as black color.

Color::Color (  ColorValue  color_value  ) 
 

Initializes the color-object with the recalculated RGB-values from the color_value.

Color::Color (  SystemColorId  system_color_id  ) 
 

Initializes the color-object with the RGB-values indicated by the system-color system_color_id. The system-colors are defined by an instance of the class Theme.

Member Function Documentation

ColorValue Color::Blend (  ColorValue  foreground,
ColorValue  background,
UINT8  alpha = 255
)  [static]
 

Alpha-blends two colors. If alpha is specified, then the foreground color's alpha value is set to the specified value, otherwise the foreground's alpha value is used (caution: if ColorValue is 16 bit, then alpha will always be 0). If alpha is greater than 255, it will be set to 255.

Returns:
the blended color

ColorValue Color::Blend (  ColorValue  background  )  const
 

Alpha-blends two colors. this is used as the foreground color; accordingly, this's alpha value is used.

Returns:
the blended color

Color Color::Blend (  const Color &  background  )  const
 

Alpha-blends two colors. this is used as the foreground color; accordingly, this's alpha value is used.

Returns:
the blended color

UINT8 Color::GetAlpha (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
the alpha-value of the color-object. The alpha value specifies the opacity of the color, i.e. 0 == transparent, 128 == 50% translucent, 255 == opaque.

void Color::SetAlpha (  UINT8  alpha  )  [inline]
 

Sets the alpha component of the color object The alpha value specifies the opacity of the color, i.e. 0 == transparent, 128 == 50% translucent, 255 == opaque.

void Color::SetRed (  UINT8  red  )  [inline]
 

Sets the red component of the color object.

void Color::SetRgb (  UINT8  red,
UINT8  green,
UINT8  blue,
UINT8  alpha = 255
) 
 

Sets the color to the value represented by red-, green- and blue-portions. Optionally an alpha-channel can be specified. Note that in the planes-mode invoking this method needs a lot of runtime, because the closest similar color must be searched from the color-table for each call.

void Color::SetValue (  ColorValue  color_value  ) 
 

Sets the color to the value represented by color_value.
